page.title: 11RELIGION IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: In{Higham-on-the-Hill}there are two churches.The{Methodist Church}is adapted from two cottages and opened in 1959.Adjoining the church is a {Cruck cottage. { St.Peter's Church}was built in the 13th Century and extended in the 19th Century.The Rector takes charge of sveral Livings.The team of bellringers ring the Church bells regularly.An annual{Church Fete}takes place where various organisations help with games, stalls etc.. {The Rev.Geoffrey Francis Fisher of {Lambeth}was born in the village in 1887 and died in 1972.He was {Archbishop of Canterbury 1945-1961 during which time he crowned{Queen {Elizabeth 11}at her{Coronation}He was Headmaster of Repton School,Bishop of London,Bishop of Chester and was created a Baron.
